div1.p: Lazear gives Sweitzer medical advice and makes vacation plans.

div1.head: Letter fragment from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, January 10, 1897
div1.p:
Your two
letters came yesterday
and today, the first
with check for $100
which I shall deposit
but hope it will not
be necessary to use
it for a long time.

I am sorry you
are still suffering
from the pain in the
back. If you can
reach the spot you
had better try rubbing
it hard about twice
a day. A hot water
bag ought to give
a good deal of relief.

You keep up the
cold baths, of course,
I would make
a point of rubbing
all over vigourously
with a rough towel.
I sent some tablets
in the newspaper I mailed a
day or two ago. They are the
rhubarb & soda tablets which
are to be taken after meals
when the there is indigestion.

I will send some powders
for you to take at bedtime.

Mary returned yesterday for which
we are very thankful.

We have made up our minds
to go to Beverly. We can get
inexpensive board there. Mrs. Houston
and Nellie are to be there. Mr.
& Mrs Kilham have two rooms
engaged for which they are to
pay $3.00 a week. They will take
their meals out. We shall probably
make a similar arrangement.
We shall go to Boston by sea.
